Methinks somebodys been watching way to much STAR TREK.

The TRainer base detects a power surge as the beams pass through. The base
shakes as they hit the ground. "Switch to variable shielding." Ignatius
called outloud.

I see your multiphase weaponry and raise you shields.

The shields switched frequency to match the weapon that had just passed
through, each time the scanners detected an energy surge they would now
automaticallly adjust the frequency to counter the blast.

Scanners were suddenly mixxed up when flames appeared everywhere.
Halucinagen had made his image, but Ignatius was still cautius. "SEal off
the base, possible fuel leak outside." there was only one logical reason for
the flames, that was the only reason that dessert sand could catch fire.

----- Original Message -----
From: <Legendarynemasis@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, June 02, 2001 6:27 PM
Subject: Re: ATTACK!


> --- In nbwrpg@y..., RoboRick007 <rfa007@h...> wrote:
> > ::DrillBit::
> >
> > "Lets go Killfest!"
> > He runs through the tunnel catching up with Cygnar. He comes out the
> > other side, opening fire on the nearest Trainer. His massive
> gattaling
> > gun blazing.
>
> Inside the Violator, Skywarp, Gemini 1, and Destruction arrive on the
> bridge and immediately go to their stations. Gemini 1 laughs as he
> watches on a vid screen Cygnar and Drillbit coming out of a hole
> behind the trainers shields.
>
> Gemini 1: "This is so going to piss those two guys off..."
>
> Gemini 1 laughs evily as he presses a few buttons and 4 panels on the
> ship open up and four odd looking laser cannons rise from them.
> Quickly each locks onto Cygnar and Drillbit. The first two then open
> fire on Drillbit and the other two open fire on cygnar. As each beam
> travels towards its intended target they reach the trainers shield,
> which would by any means would have stopped the beams from reaching
> their intended targets. However these were no ordinary laser cannons,
> and these were no ordinary laser beams, instead of being stopped by
> the shields, the 4 beams passed harmlessly through them showing no
> signs of slowing down.
>
> Gemini 1: "Gotta love Multiphase laser cannons..."
>
>
